title: material
description: The material appearance of a primitive.

pbrMetallicRoughness.description: A set of parameter values that are used to define the metallic-roughness material model from Physically-Based Rendering (PBR) methodology.

scale.description: The scalar multiplier applied to each normal vector of the normal texture.
scale.gltf_detailedDescription: The scalar multiplier applied to each normal vector of the texture. This value is ignored if normalTexture is not specified. This value is linear.

normalTexture.description: The index of the texture containing the normal map.
normalTexture.gltf_detailedDescription: The index of the texture containing the normal map. Each texel represents the XYZ components of a normal vector in tangent space. <TODO: Add more explaination on how XYZ is calculated>.

strength.description: A scalar multiplier controlling the amount of occlusion applied.
strength.gltf_detailedDescription: A scalar multiplier controlling the amount of occlusion applied. A value of 0.0 means no occlusion. A value of 1.0 means full occlusion. This value is ignored if the corresponding texture is not specified. This value is linear.

occlusionTexture.description: The texture containing the occlusion map.
occlusionTexture.gltf_detailedDescription: The texture containing the occlusion map. The occlusion map is a greyscale texture, with white indicating areas that should receive full indirect lighting and black indicating no indirect lighting. <Todo: sRGB ? Color Space>.

emissiveTexture.description: The texture containing the emissive map.
emissiveTexture.gltf_detailedDescription: The texture containing the emissive map. The emissive map controls the color and intensity of the light being emitted by the material. This texture contains RGB components in sRGB color space. If a fourth component (A) is present, it is ignored.

emissiveFactor.description: The RGB components of the emissive color of the material.
emissiveFactor.gltf_detailedDescription: The RGB components of the emissive color of the material. If an emissiveTexture is specified, this value is multiplied with the texel values.
